subject: Re: [junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException error in ant junit target
msgSnippet: Hi, I found a faq in the ant faq in jakarta website that talks about issue being associated with class loaders. I think that is the issue here. Trying to
messageBody:
Hi,
I found a faq in the ant faq in jakarta website that
talks about issue being associated with class loaders.
I think that is the issue here. Trying to follow the
suggestions given there. The URL for this is

http://ant.apache.org/faq.html#delegating-classloader

I am currently trying the remedy suggested in the faq.
thanks for all the help from this list so far.
vijay

--- Bill_de_h�ra <dehora@...> wrote:
>
> > <path id="aweb.classpath">
> > <pathelement
> location="${deploydir}/WEB-INF/classes"/>
> > <fileset dir="${deploydir}/WEB-INF/lib">
> > <include name="*.jar"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <fileset dir="${container.home}/common/lib">
> > <include name="*.jar"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <fileset dir="${ant.home}/lib">
> > <include name="junit.jar"/>
> > <include name="optional.jar"/>
> > </fileset>
> > <!--This needs to be modified for dev purposes
> as they will have
> > actuate home already set-->
> > <fileset dir="../reports">
> > <include name="*.jar"/>
> > </fileset>
> > </path>
>
> Is TestTemp.class under any of those paths?
> [Probably not]
>
> Bill de h�ra
>
> --
> Sorry, I don't know the word "sorry".- SHRDLU
>
>
